name: Special Focus Lower Body Level 1
description:
#### Special Focus: Lower Body Level 1

This six week plan is specifically designed to boost your lower body mobility, strength and power. These short sessions will target your calves, glutes, hamstrings and quads to help you produce higher cadences at a given resistance as well as improve range of motion in your ankles, hips and low back.

​

Level 1 is the place to start if you are new to training your lower body or if you are coming back after an extended lay-off of over six months. As with all of the SYSTM strength plans, it is important to take your time and follow the progression in order to allow for adequate tissue adaptation, especially when adding jumping movements.

​

This plan may be applied in conjunction with other Special Focused strength plans, such as Upper Body or Core Focus. However, If you choose to apply concurrent plans we suggest that you do so during the off-season or at a time when your endurance training volume is low. We do not recommend adding Lower Body Focus if you are already on a training plan that includes a strength add-on.

​

The Special Focus stand alone plans follow a 2:1 progression and have three sessions per week on Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

​

Let's get to it!
planDescription: This plan is designed to target lower body strength and mobility.

prospects.name: Core & Hip Mobility A
prospects.description:
This module is a ground-based session designed to improve mobility through your hips and low back while activating and integrating muscles that are key to core stability. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Inchworm
- Pigeon Stretch
- Hip Bridge w/Knee Squeeze
- Marching Hip Bridge
- Back Extension w/Arms Overhead
- Quadruped w/Alt. Leg/Arm
- Bird Dog
- Kneeling Pelvic Tilt

prospects.name: Lower Body Focus 01
prospects.description:
_Want to develop more lower body stability, strength, and power? This series takes you through a progression of exercises focused directly on your legs and hips. To mix things up a bit, we’ll occasionally throw in a few upper body, core, and mobility moves to give those legs a break._

​

Think of Lower Body Focus 1 as a taster of a wide variety of moves that you’ll see throughout the series. This gives you a chance to develop optimal movement patterns, improve range of motion and work on your unilateral stability before moving onto more demanding sessions. These workouts are ideal for all sports that require both technical control and explosive movements. Time to Rock!

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Included Exercises**:

- Split Stance Backbend w/ Arms overhead-Right
- Recovery
- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Tip Toe Walk
- Bulgarian Lunge
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Step Overs
- Alternating-Step Under
- Hop to Opposite Leg w/Hold-Alternating
- Split Squats
- Hip Hinges
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Kneeling Hip Extension
- Hip Bridge w/ Knee Squeeze
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Inchworm from plank
- Pigeon Stretch

prospects.name: Foot & Ankle Mobility A
prospects.description:
This standing-based session is designed to improve mobility and flexibility through the foot, ankle, and calf. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. We encourage you to take a little extra time on any exercises that you find challenging. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Dynamic Calf Stretch
- Standing Ankle Dorsiflexion
- Single Leg Heel Raise

prospects.name: Lower Body Focus 02
prospects.description:
_Want to develop more lower body stability, strength, and power? This series takes you through a progression of exercises focused directly on your legs and hips. To mix things up a bit, we’ll occasionally throw in a few upper body, core, and mobility moves to give those legs a break._

​

We’re stepping things up a bit here with more multi-directional movement and controlled-landing jumps. These diverse movement patterns, which include deceleration, are crucial in sports like cyclocross and mountain biking, as well as in trail running and open water swimming, where you have to be reactive to a dynamic environment.

​

Unsure if this is the correct strength level for you?  [Click here for help.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterChooseStrengthLevel)

​

**Exercises Included:**

- Around the clock Heel & Toe Taps
- Recovery
- Recoil Hamstring Stretch
- Tip Toe Walk
- Single leg Hip Hinge
- Bulgarian Lunge
- Deep Squat w/Arms Crossed
- Step Overs
- Alternating-Step Under
- Split Squats
- Fast Side Lunge w/ Knee Lift
- Single leg squat to press w/ Same Arm
- Side Lunge to Knee Lift w/ Hold
- Scissor Jumps
- Back Extension with Hold
- Hamstring Hip Bridge
- Runners Stretch-Alternating

prospects.name: Foot & Ankle Mobility B
prospects.description:
This ground-based session is designed to improve mobility and stability through the foot, ankle, and lower leg. Take your time to work through the movements and focus on quality range of motion. We encourage you to take a little extra time on any exercises that you find challenging. Be sure to rotate through the other routines in this series on a regular basis for maximum benefit.

​

Exercises:

- Seated Foot Circles
- Seated Foot Inversion/Eversion
- Seated Foot Curls
- Seated Ankle Dorsiflexion

prospects.name: Completed Level 1 Strength
prospects.description:
Congratulations on completing Level 1 Strength!

We recommend starting on Level 2 for your next plan.
prospects.notes: Nice work. Time to level up!
